h6.span: Seashore Early Childhood Academy, Seashore Learning Center and Seashore Middle Academy

strong.i: Closed For the Remainder of the School Year

div.p: April 20, 2020
Dear Seashore Families,

On April 17, Governor Greg Abbott announced that Texas schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. As scheduled on our Seashore calendar, the last day of school is May 22, 2020. I know that this probably isn’t what most of you wanted to hear and I can tell you that it is not what our Seashore teachers and staff wanted to hear either. We miss our students! However, through distance learning, we continue our focus on keeping our students and families safe.

Seashore distance learning will continue through the end of the school year. We have built robust structures to deliver learning either online or offline and we believe it will allow your child to successfully complete the school year while we focus our planning on the reopening of next school year.

This has been an incredibly challenging time for our entire Seashore community. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we continue to deal with this unprecedented situation. We look forward to the day that we are able to welcome our students and staff back into our buildings. In the meantime, stay safe and connected to us and don’t hesitate to reach out when you need support. We will get through this challenge together.
Sincerely,
Jeanine Kidwell
Superintendent Seashore Charter Schools

p.strong: How to Access SMA Online Instructional Resources
p.br: Teachers are creating and compiling activities and resources in order to begin distance learning for your child. You will be able to find the link to all student assignments and resources on the SCS homepage website beginning Monday, March 23rd.

ol.li: On the homepage, select the Online Instructional Resources button for your school.

You can then go in to your child’s grade folder (i.e. 5th Grade) and browse each class’ sub-folder (i.e. 5th Grade Math). This is where teachers will upload activities and resources for students. They may also provide links where students can “video in” or “call in” to Virtual Classroom Hours and/or class discussion time using Zoom.
There is no cost for students to use Zoom; all they will need to access a Zoom meeting is the link that the teacher will share.
Within these folders, teachers will provide individual instructions for how to turn in completed work. Email your child’s teacher with any questions.

div.p: Note: Students who take above-grade-level Math will find their class in that grade’s folder, not their own grade’s folder.

What if my students does not have access to a device (computer, tablet, etc.) at home?
SMA has a limited number of devices that it can “check out” to students during our distance learning time. Please follow this link and complete the survey if your household does not have a device.

ul.li: These devices are only available to students with no access to a device at home.
SMA can only “check out” one (1) school device per SMA household.

Devices can be checked on Friday, March 20th from 9am-3pm in the SMA vestibule. Parents and students must sign a Device Check-Out Agreement. No students or parents will be allowed beyond the vestibule. We ask that you don’t congregate in the vestibule area. Please respect the need for social distancing if there are multiple families trying to check out a device at the same time. Patience is key.

Take the weekend to get set up with the device and troubleshoot any issues. For issues or questions regarding an SMA device that you check out, please contact the IT support teacher at jwasson@seashore.esc2.net.

div.p:
What if my student does not have access to the internet at home?
No worries! For students who are unable to access Online Resources from home, teachers have created packets of materials that they can work on at home. Please follow this link and complete the survey if your child will work off-line.

ul.li: These packets will be available in the SMA vestibule starting Monday, March 23rd. The pick-up window will be 9am-3pm. No students or parents will be allowed beyond the vestibule.
Packets will be organized by teacher and course.
Students can turn in their work in the SMA vestibule starting Thursday, March 26th. The drop-off window will be from 9am-3pm.

h4.span: Click here to join the auction and support Seashore Charter Schools!

p.em: Did you know your purchases can make a difference? AmazonSmile donates to Island Foundation Inc. when you do your holiday shopping at

strong.span: Help us pave the way to our children’s future, click here to get your brick!

div.p: Island Foundation and Seashore Charter Schools are celebrating 20 years of excellent education at our public charter schools! Since 1996, we have grown from 15 students in a one-room school house to 500+ students on our three unique campuses! Seashore has kept to the original tenets envisioned 20 years ago: small class sizes, quality teachers, stimulating curriculum, college preparatory focus, community partnership, and the ability for our parents to spend time contributing to their children’s education.

Seashore Learning Center and Seashore Middle Academy are free public charter schools educating students from Kindergarten to 8th grade. Families do NOT pay tuition. State funds provide for the basic needs but Seashore receives less funding than traditional public schools: approximately $2000 less per student per year. Seashore Charter Schools receives $0 for facilities and our Kindergarten, 1st and 2nd grade buildings are in need of immediate replacement.

You can be part of Seashore’s tradition of success by helping us raise the money to build much needed classroom space for our Kindergarten, 1st and 2nd graders. We are beginning a robust capital improvement program on both campuses. Watch for changes in coming weeks.You can help with these improvements by:

ul.li: Making a tax-deductible cash donation of any size to the Capital Campaign and 100% of your donation will be used to build new classrooms.

p.strong: Thank you for helping us Improve Our Foundation!

div.p: Contact Jeanine Kidwell at jkidwell@seashore.esc2.net for more information
Schools serving from 3 year olds to 8th graders.
Teaching young minds and enriching lives.
Serving families with education and community programs.
Empowering the Padre Island community through education.

h4.span: Empowering a community to achieve educational excellence and community programs through positive energy.

div.p: Empowering children with an education to enrich their lives and make a difference in their community.
Working with the community to facilitate programs and educational opportunities. Our community involvement encompasses a variety of enrichment classes and the Island’s annual La Posada event.

h4.span: To serve and support education and community interests on Padre Island.

div.p: Preparing the youngest members from 6 weeks – pre K for a lifetime of learning.
SLC was our first charter school and is now educating 200+ children kindergarten – 4th grade.
Our most recent school was opened for 5th – 8th grades with a capacity for 300 students.

The difference between Island Foundation schools and other excellent schools is the dedication and hard work of the teachers and administration and the genuine interest that the faculty has for our kids. Our kids get a private school education tuition free.

div.h4: Seashore Charter Schools anti-bullying policy and reporting system.

div.div: Seashore Charter School website is designed and sponsored by:

Seashore Learning Center and Seashore Middle Academy will not discriminate in admissions based on gender, national origin, ethnicity, religion, disability, academic, artistic, or athletic ability, or the district the child would otherwise attend.
© 2016 - The Island Foundation - Seashore Charter Schools
